intro: Galium praecox, commonly known as white bedstraw, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its slender, erect stems and small, white or pale pink flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. Its leaves are opposite, simple, and often have a hairy texture. Galium praecox is also known for its medicinal uses in traditional herbal remedies.
